title: Suspected Brown University shooter found dead in New Hampshire | ABC NEWS
description: The primary suspect in a fatal mass shooting at Brown University has been found dead with a self-inflicted gunshot wound. The body of 48-year-old Claudio Neves Valente was found in a storage facility in Salem, New Hampshire. Two students were killed and nine others injured in the attack at the Ivy League school in Providence, Rhode Island. title: How the Port Arthur massacre changed Australia's gun laws | ABC NEWS
description: The 1996 Port Arthur massacre remains the deadliest shooting committed by a single individual in Australian history, after 28-year-old Martin Bryant shot dead 25 people, and wounded 23 others.  In the wake of the attack, then-Prime Minister John Howard, with bipartisan support, introduced the National Firearms Agreement, which resulted in a near-total ban on all fully automatic and semi-automatic rifles and shotguns in Australia. New laws established uniform licensing, a national gun registry, and a 28-day waiting period for firearm sales. title: Bill Gates and Noam Chomsky among those in latest Epstein photo dump | ABC NEWS
description: Another batch of photos from sex trafficker Jeffrey Epstein's estate has been published online by Democrats. Several high-profile men appear in some images, including Noam Chomsky and Bill Gates, while others display quotes from Vladimir Nabokov's controversial novel Lolita handwritten on a young woman's body. It comes on the eve of the highly-anticipated release of the Epstein files. title: Fri Fix: Sincaraz, Novak, Sabalenka and Nick
description: The Australian Open is less than a month away and if you're anything like us, you might feel like you've lost track of what's going on in tennis. Ex-Davis Cup Captain Wally Masur is here to help. He gets us across the Sincaraz rivalry, Novak's push for one more slam, the Nick Kyrgios situation and Aryna Sabalenka's dominance of the women's game. PLUS, a vibe check on the broader Aussie contingent. Featured: Wally Masur, ex-Davis Cup Captain.    Subscribe to the ABC Sport Newsletter (https://www.abc.net.au/connect)

title: Temperatures soar in south-east states with forecast storms ahead | ABC NEWS
description: A severe heatwave is sweeping the south-east states, with Sydney recording its warmest day in seven years at 42.2°C. In the lead-up to Christmas, a burst of showers and thunderstorms will follow the soaring temperatures. title: Proposed gun buyback scheme facing criticism inside and outside government | ABC NEWS
description: The federal government has announced it will fund a national buyback scheme to reimburse gun owners who hand in surplus, newly banned or illegal firearms under tougher gun laws being proposed in the wake of the Bondi terror attack.   Labor will first have to get legislation through parliament to provide funding for the scheme, which it said would be split 50:50 with the states, with the Coalition yet to formally commit its support for gun law reform. title: NSW Premier announces new proposed powers on protesting and guns | ABC NEWS
description: "Extraordinary" and "unprecedented" is how the New South Wales Premier Chris Minns is describing proposed powers to prevent mass protests during a terror event. State parliament will be recalled to debate emergency reforms, which include the banning of the Islamic State flag, and enacting Australia's toughest gun laws. title: Police release all seven men arrested in national security operation | ABC NEWS
description: All seven men arrested in Sydney over fears "a violent act was possibly being planned" have now been released, NSW police say. NSW Police Commissioner Mal Lanyon said the group of men from Victoria will continue to be monitored while in the state. It's an incident that spotlights a feeling of unease across the nation in the wake of the Bondi Beach terror attack. title: NT Firearms Council pushes back on gun control debate | ABC News
description: The Northern Territory Firearms Council is pushing back against calls for urgent changes to gun laws, saying there should be no limit on the number of weapons a person can own. Following Sunday's terror attack at Bondi Beach that killed 15 people, Prime Minister Anthony Albanese convened a national cabinet meeting where state and territory leaders unanimously agreed to bolster gun ownership rules. title: Man resembling Bondi gunman Naveed Akram caught on Philippines CCTV in mid-November | ABC NEWS
description: Bondi gunman Naveed Akram has been captured on CCTV walking down the street in Davao City in mid-November, according to local hotel staff who identified him in the footage.  The ABC has also viewed logs from the hotel that show Naveed Akram checked in on November 1 and checked out on November 28.
